description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ah1ll","text":"This protocol descried detailed steps on how to isolate and store PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples. By following this protocol, you can isolate and store PBMCs for up to 1 year. Then you can perform antibody staining on samples of different timepoints/batches for flow cytometry analysis once. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7bklk","text":"Collect 2 tubes of 10ml of blood in EDTA tubes and transport to the laboratory in an ice box.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"57scs","text":"Spin samples at 1600 rpm (2500 x G) for 10 minutes in collection tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f9tm3","text":"Spin plasma at 1800 rpm for 10 minutes and transfer/aliquot to 1ml labelled cryovials and store in -80 Â°C freezer for cytokines analyses. (Label cryovials with project name, subject ID number, date and time of sample collected, and initial of who processed the samples).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f5rse","text":"Dilute remaining blood by adding equal volume (of collected plasma samples, around 4ml) of PBS per tube and mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3s6m1","text":"Add 5ml of Ficoll to a sterile 15ml conical tube and overlay diluted blood (always use a 1:2 ratio of Ficoll to blood)-one tube per tube of blood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5cm2n","text":"Spin samples at 2200 rpm for 25 minutes at room temperature with no brake or acceleration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"207q3","text":"Collect interface (between PBS and Ficoll) and transfer to a new 15mL conical tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eoina","text":"Wash the cells with 12ml 1XPBS and spin samples at 1700 rpm for 8 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1uh3n","text":"10.  Perform second wash by discarding supernatant and bringing the volume up to 15ml with PBS then spin samples at 1500 rpm for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"28rth","text":"11.  Discard supernatant and completely break up pellet, resuspended in 10 mL PBS and count cells using cell counter (Countess, Invitrogen), record total number of cells in each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"amsbb","text":"12.  Freeze the resuspend cells in cold freezing media (90% FBS, 10% DMSO) transfer 1 ml to labeled cryovials (label as detailed in plasma samples) and place in Mr. Frosty which is filled with 100 Ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c26mf","text":"13.  Freeze at least 4x10^6 cells per vial and aim for at least 2 vials per sample. Record number of vials to be frozen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2g367","text":"14.  Store Mr. Frosty in -80 Â°C freezer overnight and transfer cryovials to liquid nitrogen the following morning for future Flow cytometry analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e1pof","text":"15.  Both -80 Â°C freezer and liquid nitrogen tank need to be locked to protect these samples according to approved IRB protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Isolation and storage of PBMCs from human peripheral blood samples
